title: Your Tuesday Briefing: Anxiety in China
description: Plus Ukraine updates, a U.S.-Iran World Cup preview and a “She Said” interview.

title: Chinese Unrest Over Lockdowns Upends Global Economic Outlook
description: Growing protests in the world’s biggest manufacturing nation add a new element of uncertainty atop the Ukraine war, an energy crisis and inflation.

title: A U.S.-Iran Soccer Showdown Intensifies With Protests as a Backdrop
description: The unrest that has gripped Iran for the past two months has heightened what would already have been a tense encounter at the World Cup in Qatar on Tuesday between the two geopolitical foes.

title: Russian Forces Fortify Lines of Defense in Southern Ukraine
description: The Institute for the Study of War said Russia appears to view the prospect of a Ukrainian counteroffensive as a serious threat after Moscow pulled back from Kherson.

title: Mpox: WHO renames Monkeypox Citing Racial Stigma
description: Health experts said the old nomenclature was imprecise, played into racist stereotypes and fueled stigmatization, making it harder to contain the most recent outbreaks.

title: A Sikh Temple in India Fights Loneliness With Companionship
description: A village in northern India has found a way to address a growing global issue: a deep sense of isolation among older people.

title: At a China Covid Protest, a Mix of Giddy Elation and Anxiety
description: In a country where protests are swiftly quashed, many who gathered to voice their discontent — under the watchful eye of the police — were uncertain about how far to go.

title: Belarus’s Foreign Minister Dies Suddenly, State Media Reports
description: Vladimir Makei served 10 years as the foreign minister of Belarus, a key geopolitical battleground between Russia and the West.

title: For Putin’s Opponents, Exile From Russia Proves a Boon
description: The political network of Aleksei A. Navalny, the imprisoned opposition leader, had seemingly been crushed. But working from abroad, the Navalny team is using YouTube to spearhead antiwar efforts.

title: Zelensky Urges Ukrainians to Brace for More Attacks as Frigid Weather Sets In
description: The state energy company asked Ukrainians to keep saving electricity to avoid overwhelming a power grid hobbled by repeated Russian attacks.

title: Memes, Puns and Blank Sheets of Paper: China’s Creative Acts of Protest
description: In a country where the authorities have little tolerance for open dissent, demonstrators against Covid restrictions have turned to more subtle methods.

title: 3 Weeks After Hack, This Island Nation’s Government Is Still Off-line
description: Vanuatu has said little about a Nov. 6 cyberattack, which has caused significant inconveniences for many of its 320,000 people.

title: The Covid Protests in China, Explained
description: Strict Covid restrictions are hurting the country’s economy and angering members of the public, who are taking to the streets. Here’s the latest on the situation.

title: Amid Scandals and Politics, Poland’s Youths Lose Faith in Catholic Church
description: The Polish church is in a deep crisis, as its authority is sapped by cascading sexual abuse scandals and as more people grow wary of its perceived alliance with the country’s right-wing government.

title: For Visits With Michelangelo’s David, She Brings a Duster
description: The revered statue in Italy is not going to dust itself. That’s where Eleonora Pucci comes in.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: Anger over Covid restrictions in China has created a crisis for its leader, Xi Jinping.

title: Mexico’s President Leads Supporters in March Through Capital
description: Tens of thousands of Mexicans walked through the streets Sunday to show their support for President Andrés Manuel López Obrador amid some pushback to his political agenda in recent weeks.
